text: Underrated game and music, one of my fav game of all time.

text: I love this game...why is it not available on 3ds or wii, or wii u, or fn anywhere.
author: Bigbudd0045

text: Thank you SupraDarky..Thank you for this.
author: NeonDeity

text: Such an underrated soundtrack. So many great soundscapes, ambient textures and unusual, exotic melodies, which really is a feat to pull off on a SNES.
author: Bun Bee

text:
Not a lot of games can pull that off, even today.

Recently though, I was amazed at the ambient sounds in the 2nd gameplay demo of MGS Ground Zeroes. 

/watch?v=EOLRfnC84fQ (around 02:50, for instance)

It takes place on a naval base in Cuba. You can hear both seagulls and some kind of "South American jungle" sound, it's very well done, very accurate (not to mention the wind blowing on the tents and other details).
author: flyingfoxxx1984

text: This game has one of the best soundtracks I've ever heard. Made the game so much better.
author: SDREHXC

text: Wow, this score really gets under your skin and starts crawling around. Creepy and eerie yet so beautiful and tranquil. Masterful.
author: knasbollicus

text: I agree with that, the atmosphere in this game...

text: we got both in Canada

text: What are you talking about? Of course Americans got Mana. Way before us!
author: flyingfoxxx1984

text: Listening to this song made me want to replay the game...
author: Ragnarokender

text: I think SoM did get released in the US, but its sequel didn't. SoE had "Secret of" added to its name to ride on the popularity of SoM a bit.
author: Sayeth Di Puppeth

text: Yeah, and the japanese did Secret of Mana. Both were great games. I'm glad to be an European, because back in the days, when Nintendo and Sega were the two top console-companies, we got both games, while Americans just got SoE and Japanese just got SoM.
author: Fr0zenNightmare

text:
This is an American game. Published by square... Or made by square American branch or something. I just know we are responsible for this game.
 Take that Japanese people.

text: Great choice.

text: Holy crap, he was 19 when he made this? */me looks at himself and weeps*

text: I'm a bit surprised this game made your list. I've enjoyed the tracks you've uploaded from this game but didn't think it would end up on your Top 30. Mainly because this game is always overshadowed by Secret of Mana (which I'm expecting will be in your to 10 if your past posts are anything to go by)

text:

That's awesome!

text: I loved the fact that your dog changed depending on the setting.

text: Can't wait to see your top 10, but that's going to have to wait, as we're still on #25. I'm guessing Chrono Trigger will be in your top 10.
author: Happytreefriendsfan3

text: I'm not a huge fan of this game; the difficulty is pretty uneven and requires a substantial amount of grinding, unless you abuse the atlas glitch. That said, this game did have unique atmosphere, and a unique premise, rather than the generic "save the world" affair.
author: GoRedskinsAndWizards

text: What an incredibly underrated game. Easily one of my favorites on the SNES, but completely overlooked.  <3
author: skaman8348

text: The Hall of Collosia, my favorite song.
author: Sephiko

text: Ah I didn't know about the branch. thanks
author: kyokushin25mgt

text: I did enjoy this game, but what bugged me was the name. Is their any link what-so-ever between Secret of Evermore and Secret of Mana?
author: kyokushin25mgt

text: Wow, thanks Supra.  Way way way back when web-pages were young, this song played over a the home page of a website I visited, and it was a personal favorite.  I never knew what it was or where from, but I'm glad I do now.
author: TedKennedyX

text: Love this game. Still kinda wish we got Seiken Densetsu 3 along with it. Though I'm not a fan on how Square took direction of the Mana Series. SoE 2 would of been a game I'd like to see but I feel this game is going to get lost in time and history.

text:
I'm guessing he's going to at least put SoM in his top 10, maybe top 5.

author: Jirt

text: Good to see Secret of Evermore made it! I much preferred it to Secret of Mana, this game is so clever and out there.
author: Cyrodilic Spadetail

text: I'm willing to bet money you will have your answer later on in this list ;)  However, it might be awhile till SoM shows up heh
author: xSayPleasex

text: So far, your list is really surprising me! I didn't expect to see this on the list, and I thought SMRPG was going to be higher up.
author: Jirt

text: Jeremy Soule is the freaking man. It is so amazing that the guy did Morrowind-Skyrim, Guild Wars, and Secret of Evermore and they all sound so different. This guy can make fantastic music no matter what format it is.
author: IAMVOLTMAN

text: This game was like a darker, more atmospheric Secret of Mana. Which game do you prefer?
author: Melchiorblade7

text: About half the game is enhanced by his music, and the other half is enhanced by his choice of having NO music at the right moments, just ambient sounds. I find that masterful. Listen to something like "Ambience - Swamplands" from this game on YouTube. It really captures the imagination while you're running around with your dog, you almost feel constantly threatened by what you can't even see. Not a lot of games back then could pull that off.
author: SupraDarky

text: After recently replaying this game, I realized I not only really liked SoE, but it's also one of my favorites. Not a lot games can manage to make me feel like I'm being transported into another world (a feeling I got while playing the Oculus Rift), but this game absolutely does. The #1 thing that sets this game apart for me is its atmosphere, and it wouldn't have been the same without 19 year old Jeremy Soule's contribution.
author: SupraDarky
